New Records: LaMelo Ball joined Steph Curry (5x) as the second NBA player to ever record 30+ 3-pointers in his team’s first six games of the season
Key Match Events: Charlotte ripped off a 17-2 run in the opening four minutes of the third, quickly slicing Boston’s lead from 18 down to three
Post-Match Reflections: Hornets Head Coach Charles Lee: 'I’m extremely happy with the group that came to the floor in the second half. We won the second half by eight points. There are no consolation prizes or anything, but the competitive level we had to get back into the game… I thought in the first half, we actually had some pretty good looks. The Celtics did a good job just punishing us for a bad rotation or a bad execution on a pick-and-roll coverage. They capitalized on a lot of those opportunities. In the second half, we just did a better job of tightening the screws.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brandon Miller returned after missing the team’s past four games with a left glute strain
Others: The Hornets were forced to use smaller lineups without centers Mark Williams and Nick Richards
Boston capitalized on the size advantage to win the rebound battle by 10 (44-34)
The free-throw discrepancy was significant and decisive, with Boston knocking down 25-of-28 attempts (89.3%), while Charlotte went only 6-of-9 (66.7%; all in the first half)
